answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links which may be useful start to your research.
The Midwest Shelter for Homeless Veterans was built using a special use permit granted by the Wheaton, IL City Council. 
http://www.helpaveteran.org/about.htm
The building of the Lawrence Community Shelter in Lawrence, Kansas was also approved using a special use permit.
http://www.lawrenceshelter.org/index-4.html
A few years ago a special use permit was used to build a homeless shelter in Kitsap County, WA. 
http://www.bremertonpatriot.com/news/23155704.html
You can view how Chapel Hill, NC has used special use permits to build a number of shelters.
http://www.townofchapelhill.org/index.aspx?page=1442
This is a sample special use permit application for overnight shelters from San Jose, CA.
http://www.sanjoseca.gov/planning/applications/dev_sup_tos_app.pdf
This is a Planning Commission Staff Report from Louisville, KY which describes Land Development Code amendments for homeless shelters.
http://www.louisvilleky.gov/NR/rdonlyres/8655978A-E7DF-44CC-8E34-116CC9A2AEB6/0/HShelterCase14879StaffReport.pdf
I have also included some outreach programs that have been developed to help address homelessness. 
This is a comprehensive, “10-Year Strategy to End Homelessness,” from San Bernardino County, CA.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9181/10Year_Strategy_to_End_Homelessness_in_San_Bernardino_County
This program from Austin, Texas helps homeless individuals transition into financial independence.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2159/Homeless_SelfSufficiency_and_Responsibility_Initiative
Danvers and Peabody, Massachusetts have developed a summer camp program specifically for homeless children.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1701/Communities_Create_Summer_Camp_for_Homeless_Kids
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Nijah Fudge
text:
Recently my City was approched by a special interst group to allow the building of transitonal housing for the homeless within City limits- (currently not allowed by our zoning standards) 

Has your City used a Special Use permit to allow the building of a transitional housing facility for the homeless?
If so, what standards did you use when defining the terms of the permit? 
Has your City chosen to work creatively and collaboratively with community groups to facilitate education oppurtunities on commuity issues like homelessness?
title: Homelessness in your City
